taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Sporobolus vaginiflorus (Torr. ex A. Gray) Alph. Wood var. vaginiflorus

bio:treatment.description: Sheath bases usually glabrous. Spikelets mostly 3-6 mm. Glumes usually shorter than the florets; lemmas mostly 3-5.4 mm, usually 1-veined, sometimes faintly 3-veined; paleas mostly 3-5.4 mm. Fruits 1.8-2.7 mm.
bio:treatment.discussion: Sporobolus vaginiflorus var. vaginiflorus is the most wide-ranging of the two varieties, extending north into Canada.
